overview.summary: The Viewer displays interactive graphical output to the computer screen. Use the Viewer to see a geometry, or spatial data. The Viewer provides access to many simulation parameters and controls, thus, indirectly initiates new iterations of the simulation steps important to computational steering.

description.p: Autoview restores the display back to a default condition. This is very useful when objects disappear from the view window due to a combination of settings.
Set Home View captures the setting of the current view so you can return to it later by clicking the "Go home" button.
Go home restores the current home view.

Views lists a number of standard viewing angles and orientations. The view directions align with the Cartesian axes of the objects. The ``Up vector'' choice sets the orientation of the objects when viewed along the selected axis.

From the Viewer window, the left corner of the control panel contains performance indicators that document the current rendering speed for the display. More advanced graphics performance results in a higher drawing rate.
A small plus sign (``+'') appears in the lower right corner of the Viewer window. Clicking on the plus sign reveals the extended control panel.
For further documentation see Visualization with the Viewer.
